DOC.brief_summary: This trial is designed to evaluate olanzapine compared to the metoclopramide in the treatment of break through emesis after prophylaxis with dexamethasone, 5-HT 3 receptor antagonists and aprepitant in patients receiving chemotherapy. Efficacy will be assessed using a modified MASCC questionaire with a visual analog scale.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Olanzapine and Metoclopramide For Treatment Of bReakThrough Emesis
DOC.criteria: break through emesis after prophylaxis with dexamethasone, 5HT 3 receptor antagonists and aprepitant in patients receiving chemotherapy defined as vomitus or nausea>25mm on VAS signed IC psychiatric disorders drug abuse pregnancy high dose chemotherapy treatment with other antiemetic drugs
DOC.keyword: break through emesis after prophylaxis with dexamethasone, 5-HT 3RA and aprepitant
